docs.lead_paragraph: Royal Philips Electronics, the lighting and health care giant, said that fourth-quarter profit doubled to 1.39 billion euros ($2.03 billion) from 680 million for the same quarter a year ago, while sales rose 3.8 percent to 8.37 billion euros ($12.2 billion). Philips said its profit included gains from the 1.09 billion-euro ($1.60 billion) sale of stakes in several other companies, offset by 404 million euros ($591 million) in one-time charges. The medical equipment unit remained the most profitable, with earnings up 9.9 percent to 322 million euros ($471 million), despite a 2 percent fall in sales. The unit’s operating profit rose 34 percent to 170 million euros ($249 million) on a sales rise of 14 percent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of couples have been left with no visual record of their wedding day after a regional photography service closed earlier this month and filed for bankruptcy.

headline.main: Newlyweds Seething After a Photo Studio Fails to Deliver
headline.print_headline: Newlyweds Seething After a Photo Studio Fails to Deliver

docs.snippet: Hundreds of couples have been left with no visual record of their wedding day after a regional photography service closed earlier this month and filed for bankruptcy.
